intro: Sedum spathulifolium var. majus, commonly known as the broad-leaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically broad and spatulate in shape, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to gardens.
